title: EMEA Finance Names Citi Best Foreign Bank in Bahrain
summary: Manama, Bahrain - EMEA Finance magazine has named Citi "Best Foreign Investment Bank," for the third consecutive year, and "Best Foreign Bank in Bahrain" as part of the magazine's Middle East Banking Awards 2013. The awards were recently announced at a charity awards dinner held at Jumeirah Emirates Towers in Dubai.
tag-1: EMEA Finance Names Citi Best Foreign Bank in Bahrain
tag-2: Manama, Bahrain – EMEA Finance magazine has named Citi "Best Foreign Investment Bank," for the third consecutive year, and "Best Foreign Bank in Bahrain" as part of the magazine's Middle East Banking Awards 2013. The awards were recently announced at a charity awards dinner held at Jumeirah Emirates Towers in Dubai.
tag-3: EMEA Finance is a bimonthly publication that reports on the major financial events and happenings initiated and influenced by the international financial industry active in Europe, Middle East, and Africa (the EMEA region).
tag-4: "We are pleased to have received the EMEA Finance award for the best foreign bank in Bahrain for the third year in a row and the Best Foreign Bank in Bahrain for 2013," said Mazin Manna, CEO of Citi Bahrain. "We are committed to continue to work with our clients to deliver our global network and capabilities and to offer innovative and customized solutions to our Institutional and Consumer clients."
tag-5: According to EMEA Finance's criteria, "Awards recognize the leading banks across the Middle East that stand out among their peers, demonstrate leadership in their home markets and top the performance and deal-making tables both in individual countries and across the Middle East. The awards consider various performance and structural factors, such as market share, growth in important product classes and corporate strategy."
tag-6: Citi has been in the Arab world for nearly 50 years and views the region as critical to its global franchise. It currently offers full-scale corporate and investment banking services across 10 Arab countries, including Bahrain, UAE, Qatar, Kuwait, Lebanon, Jordan, Egypt, Tunisia, Morocco and Algeria.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
